Description: Model of double cornucopia of Arsinoe II Philadelphos. A model of the double cornucopia of Arsinoe II, with a loaf of bread, fruit (pomegranates, or two small pots), leaves and a bunch of grapes emerging from it. Summary treatment at the back. Probably hollow; two-piece mould. Micaceous brown Nile silt with traces of an overall white dressing.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV Comparanda. See a single cornucopia with much the same contents: Fjeldhagen 1995: no. 209, dated Roman Imperial period: this has awrist and hand modelled with the horn and was presumably designed to be affixed to a figure; Dunand 1990: no. 315, dated Roman period, is also a single cornucopia held by a hand.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3281)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Rev Greville John Chester
